reviews.productTitle: Lutron Caseta Original Smart Switch (Lutron Smart Hub Required), for LED Lights and Fans, 6 Amp, Single-Pole/3-Way, Neutral Required, PD-6ANS-WH, White
reviews.text: I have many of these throughout my house and I give them all a 5 star. However, in the instance of my last install I had problems controlling a rope light. I replaced a basic on/off switch that controls the alcove rope light in my bedroom. Once installed, it turned the alcove rope light on but when the switch was turned off, it turned the light down to about 50% (not totally off). At first I thought it could have been a faulty manufacture, but when I replaced it with an identical Lutron switch, the same half-off phenomenon occurred. Very peculiar. Replacement of a basic on/off wall switch resulted in a totally off light.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2025
reviews.title: Strange Switch Off Situation

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Caseta Original Smart Switch (Lutron Smart Hub Required), for LED Lights and Fans, 6 Amp, Single-Pole/3-Way, Neutral Required, PD-6ANS-WH, White
reviews.text: The Lutron Caseta Smart Switch delivers on its promise of seamless smart home integration, and as Apple HomeKit users, we‚Äôre thrilled with its compatibility and rock-solid performance. Setup was straightforward, and it‚Äôs been flawlessly controlling our lights for months without a single hiccup. The app is intuitive, and voice commands via Siri work like a charm. üì±‚ú® That said, the switch‚Äôs design feels a bit dated compared to sleeker, modern Caseta models. The tactile buttons and glossy finish don‚Äôt quite match the minimalist vibe of newer smart switches. However, since it‚Äôs tucked behind furniture or in less visible spots, the aesthetic isn‚Äôt a major issue‚Äîjust a small nitpick for design-conscious users. Build quality is excellent, and we appreciate how it plays nicely with other smart systems. If you prioritize reliability and smart-home synergy over cutting-edge looks, this switch is a winner. Lutron‚Äôs reputation for durability shines here, even if the style isn‚Äôt the latest. **4 stars**‚Äîit‚Äôs a workhorse, not a showpiece! üîåüëç
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2025
reviews.title: Reliable and Smart, But Design Could Use a Refresh üè†üí°

reviews.text: If you‚Äôre looking to manage a smart home Lutron is the easiest way. You don‚Äôt need a common wire and it will replace your switch rather than add a switch and having to leave power on to a light or fan. Works with HomeKit and Alexa.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Caseta Original Smart Switch (Lutron Smart Hub Required), for LED Lights and Fans, 6 Amp, Single-Pole/3-Way, Neutral Required, PD-6ANS-WH, White
reviews.text: I've been using the Lutron Caseta switches for almost 3 years now. This after going to someone's house that used another solution and got it wrong. He calls out... XXXXX turn on the kitchen light.... nothing... Oh wait, someone turned the switch off. It seemed like half the time, that was the case. I really didn't want a solution that worked 50%. Then I did some research and found other solutions that people had problems and frequently had to re-boot stuff to get it working again. I'm almost at 3 years and it just works! I use these switches for simple on/off lights, I use the fan switches to control all my ceiling fans and I use the dimmer switches on most of my lights so I can control lighting levels, most using scenes and automation including turning my entrance light on when I get home and a light inside. Then 5 minutes later, turn the entrance light off. If someone physically turns the light off manually, no problem, the assistant can still follow the command and turn it on. These are especially good as an investment since they work with most personal assistants.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2024
reviews.title: VERY reliable

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Caseta Original Smart Switch (Lutron Smart Hub Required), for LED Lights and Fans, 6 Amp, Single-Pole/3-Way, Neutral Required, PD-6ANS-WH, White
reviews.text: I have never questioned the quality and reliability of the Caseta network. It works as reliably as a finger press but is so much easier. Despite an older tech...it works when others don't. I have been a smart home user for almost two decades and can't recommend this product enough. HomeKit support and easy install make this product stand out, but the reliability makes it shine...or maybe that is the light bulb it turned on 99.999999% of the time.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2024
reviews.title: Reliable...reliable and did I say reliable?

This switch replaced a standard decora switch. The lights may be turned ON/OFF and this unit works with a hub that along with a phone app allows remote use AND scheduled use. So I have exactly what I want. The lights are scheduled to come on at dusk and go off at dawn and I don't have to remember (especially to switch them off during the day).

reviews.text: I bought 2 Lutron Caseta switches for my porch lights so I can program them to turn on/off at scheduled times. I have the Caseta switches controlling most of the switches in my home and they work flawlessly. The 2 switches that arrived were already used and the wires were still twisted from being in the wire nuts. Two things here... I'm not paying $60 per switch for used items and I'm not attempting to hook up a switch that some yay-hoo probably fried from hooking it up wrong and decided to return it. Looks like I'll be making a trip to the local hardware store.

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Caseta Original Smart Switch (Lutron Smart Hub Required), for LED Lights and Fans, 6 Amp, Single-Pole/3-Way, Neutral Required, PD-6ANS-WH, White
reviews.text: WARNING: Bought a 3 USED Lutron CASETA Smart switches for the remodel of our lower level in 2021. Thought I could save a few bucks. I had no idea what a crapshoot it would turn into. Finally got the electrical wrapped up this December 2022. Turns out that 1 switch was the Maestro version (non-smart model), another was dead and the last one worked. My Electrican told me before installing them that dead ones are common with USED switches and Outlets. We found that out the hard way how true that is. Unfortunately, we are well beyond the return date. This part is my fault. The person or company who returned these products should have "the day they deserve" and Amazon, at the very least, should have made sure the right product was shipped. I'm positive that Amazon doesn't check returns for functionality, but that might be a good idea for some products. DO NOT BUY USED ELECTRICAL SWITCHES UNLESS THEY HAVE BEEN VERIFIED/TESTED!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2023
reviews.title: Don't buy USED electrical switches!!!

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Caseta Original Smart Switch (Lutron Smart Hub Required), for LED Lights and Fans, 6 Amp, Single-Pole/3-Way, Neutral Required, PD-6ANS-WH, White
reviews.text: This product is advertised as being compatible with HomeKit, which it is‚Ä¶.barely. In order to set up this switch you need Lutron‚Äôs ‚Äòbridge‚Äô (an added expense) and that bridge needs to be hard-wired to your router. There is no way to set this up without the bridge hardware. If you have other Lutron products and already own the bridge, this might work for you. If you don‚Äôt own a bridge there doesn‚Äôt appear to be a way to set this switch up, unlike MANY competitors that don‚Äôt have that issue.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2022
reviews.title: HomeKit users beware

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Caseta Original Smart Switch (Lutron Smart Hub Required), for LED Lights and Fans, 6 Amp, Single-Pole/3-Way, Neutral Required, PD-6ANS-WH, White
reviews.text: I power washed the house several weeks ago and forgot to pull the little mini slider turn off on my switch, anyways the yellow Feit Florescent bulb blew, I tried to replace it with an LED bulb however, it would not work. I knew why, there was no common (white) wire on my existing switch. I bought mine many years ago when they came out. As everyone knows the light bulb industry switched from florescent energy saving in favor of LED bulbs. The old tech without the common (white) wire on the switch will not work with the new LED bulbs, so keep that in mind if your in a similar situation like me. The good news was all three Pico remotes I had programmed to this outdoor switch I was able to re-program and they worked beautifully, thank God. Being able to turn on your outdoor lighting when you drive up to a dark driveway at night is a major safety convenience as well as turning on your lighting from your easy chair without getting up is another nice feature.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2022
reviews.title: 2nd Gereration, Upgraded Switch

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Caseta Original Smart Switch (Lutron Smart Hub Required), for LED Lights and Fans, 6 Amp, Single-Pole/3-Way, Neutral Required, PD-6ANS-WH, White
reviews.text: I own a 1985 home that I've recently been trying to add some smart functions. I got hooked into smart home tech after solving a few basic quality of life issues through automation. My next project was lighting. I debated between adding smart bulbs or smart switches and after trialing these Lutron's - the smart switches clearly won. These basic on/off switches are great for locations where you don't want dimming functions. Locations such as fans, fluorescent ballasts, outdoor security lights and the like. They provide simple push on-off capabilities, "smart" on/off through the Lutron app and in my case, advanced control using an integration with Home Assistant. It's really cool to see and control the status of my lighting/fans, regardless of where I'm at. Pairing the switches with your Lutron hub was quite intuitive and easy to do. Just press a button while you add the switch in the app. Integration into Home Assistant was equally easy, the native Lutron integration is quite slick. For examples of how I use these switches for advanced automation? If I take a shower, I use humidity values to turn on or off my exhaust fans. I also have motion detection triggering the lighting in my bathrooms, entry way and closets. (No more "turn the lights off" from me anymore!) For outdoor lighting, I can now control it based on AI-analyzed security cameras. No more security lights turning on because of snowfall, heavy rain or animals - it's for people only! Install of these is generally fairly easy in most cases. If you understand electrical basics, such as the load wire, the neutral wire and the hot wire(s), they are pretty straight forward to install. 3-way applications get a bit more tricky where you have to use a Pico remote, which seems to make sense so you don't have smart things fighting with each other. Installation requires a few very basic hand tools. For the most part, these are fairly slim and fit into their boxes quite well. I did have some challenges in a couple boxes that had a lot going on, but made it work. I definitely recommend using Wago connectors for your retrofit, they make connections a breeze compared to wire nuts. If you're concerned about electricity or think it's beyond your ability, an electrician should be able to install these without any troubles. I think with smart technology, it's very important to define "rules" by which the stuff will operate. These are mine. First, everything has to operate intuitively, like a light switch would. Second, it has to operate without any "fancy" server side smarts or network capabilities. Three, it has to integrate with my home automation system of choice as I don't want to be beholden to any particular vendor or app. Generally speaking, these Lutron's satisfy my requirements. If you're in the market for smart switches, these are about as good as they get. I've been really happy with the advanced capabilities it offers the home owner. While they are expensive, a full "smart" retrofit with a single platform is going to add value to your home, should you go to sell it. I'm glad to be partnered up with Lutron in my home, they are definitely on the "recommend" list.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2022
reviews.title: Great For Retrofitting Smart Features Into 1985 Era Home

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Caseta Original Smart Switch (Lutron Smart Hub Required), for LED Lights and Fans, 6 Amp, Single-Pole/3-Way, Neutral Required, PD-6ANS-WH, White
reviews.text: If you are tired of the dreaded "No Response" in HomeKit, these are probably the best switch solution. Combine with a good, solid mesh-wifi network, you will likely never see a failure. More expensive, and require a dreaded bridge for full functionality -- oh so worth it in reduced stress.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2022
reviews.title: The most stable HomeKit enabled switch out there...

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Caseta Original Smart Switch (Lutron Smart Hub Required), for LED Lights and Fans, 6 Amp, Single-Pole/3-Way, Neutral Required, PD-6ANS-WH, White
reviews.text: I have about 10 of these switches in my house, and they work flawlessly. In the past I tried switches by iDevices, Leviton, Insteon, and others. However, this Lutron one is the best. It works 100% of the time.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2022
reviews.title: Lutron Caseta is the best!

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Caseta Original Smart Switch (Lutron Smart Hub Required), for LED Lights and Fans, 6 Amp, Single-Pole/3-Way, Neutral Required, PD-6ANS-WH, White
reviews.text: Product was not New. Was obviously something that was returned. Several of the heat sink tabs had been broken off, one of the wires was taped off and there were no screws or wirenuts in the box as other new devices have had. Very disappointing.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022
reviews.title: Was not a New Product

reviews.productTitle: Lutron Caseta Original Smart Switch (Lutron Smart Hub Required), for LED Lights and Fans, 6 Amp, Single-Pole/3-Way, Neutral Required, PD-6ANS-WH, White
reviews.text: This review is more about the Lutron Caseta system. The switch is OK. It works fine. But the Caseta system includes dimmers that cannot remember the last brightness setting!!!! Even the $120 dimmers can only remember a "favorite" default setting, as opposed to the last setting. This renders the complete system useless. The previous Lutron Maestro generation could do more; $20 dimmers from other manufacturers can do much better.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2021
reviews.title: Switch OK, but Caseta System is Broken, Dimmers Can't remember last setting
